p: The intermetallic compound NiAl is of great importance due to its unique characteristics, including its high melting point, low density, outstanding thermal conductivity and excellent oxidation resistance [ 1, 2, 3]. It is expected to substitute nickel-based superalloys as the next generation of high-temperature structural materials. Its creep properties are crucial for the high-temperature applications of NiAl; however, these are not fully understood.
